channel.title: Decent video card for a 220W power supply?
channel.description:
Alright, well I'm getting a Hauppauge HD PVR later this year, and apparently I need a better video card to retain the quality. I'm hoping to find a cheap one that works with a 220W power supply, but I've yet to find one under $100 (and I'm really hoping to spend about $40 or less; I'm not meaning for it to be used for gaming, just video capture). The only reason I don't want to replace the power supply is because I'm already a little tight on money, and I have a slimline model computer, so chances are anything above 300 probably wouldn't even fit.
Also, I only need a card with 256MB.
Any help is appreciated, thanks.

item.title: Decent video card for a 220W power supply?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:22, topic:421649”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=524307.msg3817859#msg3817859 date=1321501368]
What case do you actually have, there’s probably a PSU that will fit in it.
[/quote]I have an HP Slimline s5213w, and its roughly 10cm or 4in wide. I’m sure it could fit a different PSU (I actually think I found one that would fit just fine and is 400W!), I’m just not all too willing to get a new one just yet since I don’t have all too much money. I’ll probably be able to get more soon, but I just need to be able to pay my phone bill and such in the meantime.[/quote]

I have the same case. They make PSU’s that fit it, but they’re ridiculously expensive.

newegg.com

Mini ITX, $25 - $50, Power Supplies, Power Supplies, Components - Newegg.com

Newegg.com offers the best prices on computer products, laptop computers, LED LCD TVs, digital cameras, electronics, unlocked phones, office supplies, and more with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

I’m sure it could fit a different PSU (I actually think I found one that would fit just fine and is 400W!), I’m just not all too willing to get a new one just yet since I don’t have all too much money. [quote=“Saphire`, post:16, topic:421649”][quote author=t4 link=topic=524307.msg3817132#msg3817132 date=1321457934]

450W is the max really, nothing ever struggles with a 450W supply.

my card requires 800+
[/quote]
Recommendation not requirement, it just wont work to full ability.[/quote]
what’s the point of buying a nice card then?

item.title: Decent video card for a 220W power supply?
item.dc:creator: @JakeP JakeP
item.description:
@JakeP wrote:

Probably using a ATi Raedon HD6500 Crossfire?

Things of such high spec with like 4GB dedicated RAM in the graphics card itself will yes need probably 1000W PSU to work at its best…

Im not sure he needs a card of that quality.

item.description:

Anyway, I used to have a nVidia GeForce 8800GS.

It would run on a 220W PSU all day long, may not be the best quality but works fine, especially in a HDMI connection.[/quote]Really? I’m looking at stuff saying it needs a 400W supply ._.
